facts.fact1: Humans have five senses.
facts.fact2: Humans have more than five senses.

facts.fact1: Bats are blind.
facts.fact2: Bats have good eyesight.

facts.fact1: Humans use only 10% of their brains.
facts.fact2: Humans use virtually all parts of their brains.

facts.fact1: Sugar causes hyperactivity in children.
facts.fact2: Sugar does not cause hyperactivity in children.

facts.fact1: Napoleon Bonaparte was extremely short.
facts.fact2: Napoleon Bonaparte was of average height for his time.

facts.fact1: Goldfish can see infrared radiation.
facts.fact2: Goldfish cannot see infrared radiation.

facts.fact1: The inventor of the Pringles can was buried in one.
facts.fact2: The inventor of the Pringles can was not buried in one.

facts.fact1: Humans swallow an average of eight spiders a year while sleeping.
facts.fact2: The claim that humans swallow an average of eight spiders a year while sleeping is a myth.

facts.fact1: Glass is an amorphous solid, and old window panes are not thicker at the bottom due to it flowing like a liquid over centuries.
facts.fact2: Old glass windows are thicker at the bottom because glass slowly flows downwards over long periods.

facts.fact1: Penguins are found almost exclusively in the Southern Hemisphere.
facts.fact2: Penguins live in cold regions at both the North and South Poles.

facts.fact1: Hair and fingernails do not continue to grow after death; the skin retracts, creating an illusion of growth.
facts.fact2: Hair and fingernails continue to grow for several days after a person dies.

facts.fact1: Humans use virtually all parts of their brain over time, not just a small fraction.
facts.fact2: The popular myth is true: humans only use about 10% of their brain capacity.

facts.fact1: The Sun is actually white, but appears yellow or orange from Earth due to atmospheric scattering of blue light.
facts.fact2: The Sun's actual color, as seen from space without atmospheric interference, is yellow.

facts.fact1: Diamonds are primarily made of highly compressed carbon atoms.
facts.fact2: Diamonds are formed from compressed quartz under intense heat and pressure.

facts.fact1: Bats are mammals, belonging to the order Chiroptera.
facts.fact2: Bats are classified as birds because they possess the ability to fly.

facts.fact1: All basic tastes (sweet, sour, salty, bitter, umami) can be detected by taste receptors located across all parts of the tongue.
facts.fact2: Specific regions of the tongue are dedicated to detecting only one specific taste (e.g., tip for sweet, back for bitter).

facts.fact1: Coffee 'beans' are actually the seeds found inside the berries (cherries) of the Coffea plant.
facts.fact2: Coffee beans are botanically classified as legumes, similar to peas and peanuts.

facts.fact1: There is no historical or archaeological evidence that Viking warriors wore horned helmets into battle.
facts.fact2: Horned helmets were standard battle gear for Viking warriors, symbolizing their ferocity.

facts.fact1: The extremely high salt concentration of the Dead Sea makes the water dense, allowing people to float effortlessly.
facts.fact2: The high salinity of the Dead Sea makes it dangerous because swimmers sink very quickly.

facts.fact1: Pluto's diameter is smaller than that of Earth's Moon.
facts.fact2: Pluto is significantly larger than Earth's Moon, though smaller than Earth itself.

facts.fact1: Napoleon Bonaparte was likely of average height for a Frenchman of his era (around 5' 6" or 1.68m).
facts.fact2: Napoleon Bonaparte was famously very short, significantly below the average height of his time.

facts.fact1: The distinct 'smell of rain,' known as petrichor, is caused by oils secreted by plants and chemicals produced by soil-dwelling bacteria released into the air.
facts.fact2: The smell after rain is simply the scent of water evaporating from clean surfaces.

facts.fact1: An octopus possesses three hearts: two pump blood through the gills, and one circulates blood to the rest of the body.
facts.fact2: An octopus, like most complex animals, has a single, four-chambered heart.

facts.fact1: A giraffe's neck contains the same number of cervical vertebrae as a human neck (seven), though each vertebra is greatly elongated.
facts.fact2: Giraffes have significantly more neck bones (vertebrae) than humans to account for the length of their necks.

facts.fact1: Sloths have a very slow metabolism and typically only descend from trees to defecate about once a week.
facts.fact2: Due to their leafy diet, sloths need to defecate multiple times each day.

facts.fact1: The Earth is not a perfect sphere; it's an oblate spheroid, slightly wider at the equator than from pole to pole due to rotation.
facts.fact2: Scientific measurements confirm that the Earth is a geometrically perfect sphere.

facts.fact1: While young sunflowers track the sun (heliotropism), mature sunflowers typically remain facing east.
facts.fact2: Sunflowers continuously turn their heads to follow the sun across the sky throughout their entire lifespan.

facts.fact1: Alcohol (ethanol) is classified as a central nervous system depressant.
facts.fact2: Alcohol acts primarily as a stimulant, increasing alertness and energy.

facts.fact1: The continent of Australia is wider than the diameter of the Moon.
facts.fact2: The Moon's diameter is significantly larger than the width of Australia.

facts.fact1: Peanuts are botanically classified as legumes, growing underground, unlike true nuts which grow on trees.
facts.fact2: Peanuts are true nuts, belonging to the same botanical category as walnuts and almonds.

facts.fact1: Fried potato strips, often called 'French fries,' are widely believed to have originated in Belgium.
facts.fact2: French fries were definitively invented in Paris, France, hence their name.

facts.fact1: An airplane's flight data recorder and cockpit voice recorder ('black boxes') are required to be painted bright orange for visibility.
facts.fact2: Airplane 'black boxes' are always painted black to absorb impact energy.

facts.fact1: The combination of naturally red hair and blue eyes is the rarest hair and eye color combination in humans.
facts.fact2: Black hair and brown eyes is the rarest human hair and eye color combination globally.

facts.fact1: While all spiders produce silk throughout their lives, not all species use it to build webs for catching prey.
facts.fact2: Only spiders that construct webs are capable of producing silk.

facts.fact1: Mercury is the only metallic element that is liquid at standard conditions for temperature and pressure (STP).
facts.fact2: Besides mercury, several other metals like gallium and cesium are also liquid at room temperature.

facts.fact1: Camels' humps store adipose tissue (fat), which they metabolize for energy and water when resources are scarce.
facts.fact2: Camels store water directly in their humps, allowing them to survive long desert journeys.

facts.fact1: Chuck Yeager, in the Bell X-1, was the first person confirmed to have exceeded the speed of sound in level flight in 1947.
facts.fact2: Despite numerous attempts, the sound barrier has never been successfully broken by a human-piloted aircraft.

facts.fact1: Ostriches do not bury their heads in the sand when frightened; they may lay their heads flat on the ground to seem less visible or simply run away.
facts.fact2: The classic image is true: ostriches bury their heads in the sand as a primary defense mechanism against predators.

facts.fact1: Killer whales, or orcas, are biologically classified as the largest members of the oceanic dolphin family.
facts.fact2: Killer whales are true whales, belonging to a separate biological group from dolphins.

facts.fact1: Waters from the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans do eventually mix, though distinct boundaries can sometimes be seen due to differences in temperature, salinity, and density.
facts.fact2: The waters of the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans are chemically distinct and physically cannot mix together where they meet.

facts.fact1: Rats lack the necessary muscle structure and neural pathways to vomit.
facts.fact2: Rats can and do vomit, which is why rat poison often includes emetics.

facts.fact1: Clouds consist of microscopic droplets of liquid water or tiny ice crystals suspended in the Earth's atmosphere.
facts.fact2: Clouds are composed of water vapor, which is the gaseous state of water.

facts.fact1: The University of Oxford received its royal charter much earlier and had established teaching centuries before the rise of the Aztec Empire in the early 14th century.
facts.fact2: The Aztec Empire civilization flourished long before Oxford University was founded in England.

facts.fact1: Botanically, strawberries are aggregate accessory fruits, while true berries include bananas, avocados, and watermelons.
facts.fact2: Strawberries are the textbook example of a true berry in botanical classification.

facts.fact1: Due to the vast number of small tires produced for its toy sets, the LEGO Group is considered the world's largest tire manufacturer by number of units produced annually.
facts.fact2: Traditional automotive tire companies like Bridgestone or Michelin produce vastly more tires per year than the LEGO Group.

facts.fact1: Recent estimates suggest the number of bacterial cells living in and on the human body is roughly comparable to, or slightly less than, the number of human cells.
facts.fact2: Microbial cells, primarily bacteria, vastly outnumber human cells in the body, by at least 10 to 1.

facts.fact1: Flamingos are naturally white and turn pink from the food they eat.
facts.fact2: Flamingos are naturally pink and maintain their color regardless of diet.

facts.fact1: A group of pandas is called an embarrassment.
facts.fact2: A group of pandas is called a bamboo.

facts.fact1: The human body contains enough iron to make a nail about 3 inches long.
facts.fact2: The human body doesn't contain enough iron to make any metal object.

facts.fact1: Honey never spoils and archaeologists have found edible honey in ancient Egyptian tombs.
facts.fact2: Honey has a maximum shelf life of about 100 years before becoming toxic.

facts.fact1: The total weight of all ants on Earth is greater than the weight of all humans.
facts.fact2: The total weight of all humans on Earth is about 10 times greater than all ants.

facts.fact1: The Hawaiian alphabet has only 12 letters.
facts.fact2: The Hawaiian alphabet has 24 letters.

facts.fact1: Astronauts grow taller in space due to the spine stretching in microgravity.
facts.fact2: Astronauts shrink in space due to muscle atrophy.

facts.fact1: Lobsters communicate by peeing at each other.
facts.fact2: Lobsters communicate primarily through clicking sounds.

facts.fact1: 10% of the world's population is left-handed.
facts.fact2: Left-handedness is extremely rare, affecting less than 1% of the population.

facts.fact1: Hippopotamus milk is pink.
facts.fact2: Hippopotamus milk is blue-tinged.

facts.fact1: Russia has 11 time zones.
facts.fact2: Russia has 7 time zones.

facts.fact1: The tongue is the strongest muscle in the human body relative to its size.
facts.fact2: The masseter (jaw muscle) is the strongest muscle in the human body relative to its size.

facts.fact1: Oxford University is older than the Aztec Empire.
facts.fact2: The Aztec Empire predates Oxford University by several centuries.

facts.fact1: The average person will spend six months of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.
facts.fact2: The average person will spend two years of their life waiting for red lights to turn green.

facts.fact1: The world's oldest known living organism is a 2.4-mile-wide fungus in Oregon.
facts.fact2: The world's oldest known living organism is a 400-year-old tortoise.

facts.fact1: The original color of Coca-Cola was green.
facts.fact2: Coca-Cola has always been the same caramel color since its invention.

facts.fact1: Nintendo was founded in 1889 as a playing card company.
facts.fact2: Nintendo was founded in 1950 as an electronic toy company.

facts.fact1: The fear of long words is called hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia.
facts.fact2: The fear of long words is called macrolexiphobia.

facts.fact1: Casu marzu cheese contains live maggots that can jump up to 6 inches when disturbed.
facts.fact2: Casu marzu cheese is made with a rare fungus that creates small gas bubbles.

facts.fact1: A cloud can weigh over a million pounds.
facts.fact2: An average cloud weighs less than a ton.

facts.fact1: There are more possible iterations of a Rubik's Cube than seconds since the Big Bang.
facts.fact2: There are approximately one million possible configurations of a Rubik's Cube.
